description: An easy trail to an alpine meadows with excellent views in all directions, including north to the Marble Range.  Large concentrations of Western Spring Beauty (Claytonia lanceolata) in May.  Some deadfalls to scramble under.Well described as Hike #17 in the Lillooet Hiking Guide.
directions: Follow Highway 99 to 9 km north of Fountain turnoff, and turn uphill on the Tiffin Creek FSR.  4x4 recommended but not absolutely necessary except in wet weather.  After 9 km, take the left fork at a 3-way junction, and park at the clearing just before a creek with damaged culvert.
title: Tom Cole Trail
